Check In

Use the Check In dialog box (Actions | Check In) to check in a workfile or project after you have changed it and want to make these changes available for use at another time or by another user. The file you check out is called a workfile. Each time you check in a new variation of a workfile, it becomes a new revision in the versioned file.

Field Descriptions

General Tab
Check In From Enter the location from which the workfile will be checked in, or click the Browse button to select the location. By editing this path, you are changing the workfile location for this action only; it does not change the workfile location permanently. By default, files are checked in from the location to which they where checked out. If a file has no check out location (as when a file is locked, but not checked out), it will be checked in from its default workfile location as defined in the current workspace, unless you specify an alternate location here.
Check in using project hierarchy instead of workfile location(s) Only available when checking in a project database or project. Select to override the default workfile locations and check in files from directories (locations) that mirror the project structure relative to the workfile location specified in the Check In From field. For example, if the value in the Check In From field is c:\projdb\work and the project structure is /proj1/subproj1, /proj1/subproj2, and /proj2/subproj1, Version Manager checks in the files from c:\projdb\work\proj1\subproj1, c:\projdb\work\proj1\subproj1, and c:\projdb\work\proj2\subproj1 when this option is selected. Otherwise, Version Manager checks in the files from the default workfile locations defined for each project/subproject.
Description Enter a description of the changes made to the workfile. Version Manager uses this text for the revision description. Version Manager disables the OK button until you enter a change description.
Use change description for all This field is only available if more than one file is selected. Deselect to be prompted for a unique description for each file. Otherwise, the same change description will be used for all selected files.
If Workfile Unchanged or Older If checking in a workfile that has not changed from the locked revision or has a modification time that is older than the revision that was checked out, select one of the following:

Prompt to require confirmation before checking in the file.
Check In to check in the file anyway.
Don't Check In to prevent the file from being checked in.
After Check In Select one of the following actions to occur after the file is checked in:

Keep read-only workfile to retain a read-only copy of the workfile in the workfile location.
Delete workfile to delete the workfile after checking in the revision.
Keep revision locked to lock the new revision after checking it in.
Include files in subprojects This field is only available if a project is selected. Select to check in all files of all subprojects included in the project or project database.
Associate Issues If Tracker TrackerLink or TeamTrack SourceBridge is installed, this button displays the association dialog box. You can associate the files you are checking in with issues.
Advanced Tab
Revision Enter a new revision number for the workfile you are checking in if you want it to be a number other than the next subsequent number.

This field has two purposes. The main purpose is to specify a new revision number for the workfile you are checking in. You must enter the new revision number in the field; you cannot select it.

The second purpose of this field is to identify the locked revision you want to check in when you have multiple revisions of a versioned file checked out with a lock. In this case, you can either:
  • Select the revision number of one of the locked revisions or select a promotion group or version label associated with one of the locked revisions.
  • Not select a revision number and you will be prompted to select the revision number to check the workfile in to.
Force Branch Select to create a branch.
Version Label Enter a version label to assign to the revision or click the Browse button to select one. If checking in the revision by version label, enter a backslash before a version label that begins with a numeric character (such as \1.2label).
Float label with tip Select to allow the specified version label to move with the tip of the current trunk or branch. Click here for more information on floating labels.
If Version Label Exists If the specified version label exists, select one:

Prompt to prompt for confirmation before assigning the label to the revision.
Reassign to assign the label to the new revision.
Don't Reassign to cancel checkin if the label already exists.
Selected Files Tab
File list Review the selected files or projects for check in.
Properties button Click to display archive, configuration file, and workspace information for the selected files or projects.

See Also
